DOC.HEAD: Smithkline Sells U.S., Canadian Household Products Business
DOC.TEXT: Smithkline Beecham PLC, a major international pharmaceutical company, said Friday it has agreed to sell its U.S. and Canadian household products businesses to a West Germany company for $107 million in cash. Smithkline said the sale to Joh. A. Benckiser GmbH is consistent with its strategy of focusing on international healthcare following the merger of Smithkline Beckman Corp. with Beecham Group PLC earlier this year. Household products included in the sale are Calgon, a leading U.S. bath additive, Cling Free, a fabric softener used in driers, and Delicare, a detergent for delicate products. Smithkline said most of the products are made at a plant in Rockwood, Michigan, where 130 people are employed. The products were acquired in 1977 from Merck & Co., which retains the right to use the Calgon name for industrial products. Benckiser previously marketed Calgon household products in Europe and the purchase will give it the right to sell them in North America and other countries.
